entry.title: Exclusive Invitation: Shape the Future of AI-Assisted US Sales and Use Tax Support With Us!
entry.content:
We know as you do that maintaining your US sales and use tax information is an exacting and often time-consuming task‚Äîthat‚Äôs why we‚Äôre constantly at work to make that part of your day easier.

With that in mind, we‚Äôre inviting you to join our customer engagement initiative on the future of AI-assisted sales and use tax calculation and maintenance. We have some ideas, but we need your insights, expertise, and feedback to make sure that these ideas translate into AI-driven solutions that help you.

Here‚Äôs what we‚Äôre offering:

A sneak peek into our upcoming AI use cases tailored to simplify and enhance your sales and use tax operations;

A chance to be the first to demo these solutions and provide feedback that will directly influence their refinement; and

The opportunity to network with peers and exchange insights about the future of AI in and the overall sales and use tax landscape.

Our AI tools presently help you:

  1. Maintain your tax jurisdictions in a natural, intuitive way.
  2. Speed up onboarding for anyone doing business in the US
  3. Automatically detect and propose missing compliance configurations, simplifying the entire process.

Interested? Great! Let's connect! You can either contact me here on LinkedIn or, even better, directly register to participate in the initiative.

And of course, if you know someone else in your network who might be interested, feel free to pass along this invitation. Tax accountants, tax configuration experts, consultants‚Äîanyone who has an interest in or works with sales and use tax. Let‚Äôs build the future of AI-assisted tax solutions together!

Thanks!
Anthony Santoro and Ling Zeng

entry.title: Joule Skills: Simplifying Employee Data Updates from Chat to Case
entry.content:
üåü Introduction

In today‚Äôs digital workplace, employees expect quick and seamless HR support ‚Äî whether they‚Äôre updating personal details or submitting important requests. SAP Build Joule Skills make this possible by extending SAP Joule, the generative AI copilot, with custom business logic that connects conversational experiences to enterprise systems like SAP SuccessFactors and SAP CX Service Cloud.

This blog explores how Joule Skills transform HR operations by automating co

ü§ñ What Are SAP Build Joule Skills?

Joule Skills are custom, AI-powered extensions that enable Joule to perform specific actions or respond intelligently within your organization‚Äôs SAP landscape. With SAP Build, you can design these skills to handle structured inputs, integrate APIs, and trigger backend processes ‚Äî all while maintaining a natural, conversational flow.

In short, Joule Skills let you teach Joule new abilities, such as:

  • Updating employee data in SAP SuccessFactors
  • Creating service requests in SAP CX Service Cloud
  • Fetching policy or compliance details from Knowledge Base Articles (KBAs)
  • Guiding users through document uploads and validation

üß† What It Is

SAP Build Joule Skills let you teach Joule new capabilities ‚Äî like answering company-specific questions or triggering SAP processes (e.g., updating employee details, checking sales orders, creating service requests, etc.).

Why use Joule skills in HR?

  • Remove manual steps: guide employees with just-in-time guidance and collect exactly the data HR needs.
  • Improve accuracy: structured prompts reduce missing/incorrect data.
  • Bridge chat ‚Üí case: automatically open service cases and attach metadata and files.
  • Track compliance: add KBA (knowledge base article) checks and required documentation prompts.

üíº HR Use Case: Name Change and Emergency Contact Update

Let‚Äôs consider a real-world example.
Employee Jada is getting married and wants to update her last name and emergency contact details in the company HR system.

Here‚Äôs how Joule handles it seamlessly:

  1. Employee Interaction:
    Jada opens the HR portal and types,
    ‚ÄúI need to update my last name and emergency contact due to an upcoming marriage.‚Äù

  2. Guided Workflow:
    Joule responds with relevant KBA links, explaining required documents and steps.

  3. Data Collection:
    Joule asks for:

  • New last name
  • Emergency contact name and phone number
  • Marriage date
  • Marriage certificate upload

    Joule validates the inputs and triggers backend automation to:

    • Create a service case in SAP CX Service Cloud, ensuring HR teams can track and process the update.
    • Update Jada‚Äôs profile in SAP SuccessFactors with her new personal details automatically.
    • Confirmation:
      Joule confirms submission and provides a case reference for tracking.

üß© Why Joule Skills Matter for HR

  • Reduce manual effort: Employees can initiate updates via chat without filling multiple forms.
  • Ensure accuracy: Structured prompts ensure complete and validated data.
  • Enhance compliance: Automatically check KBAs or policy documents before submission.
  • Improve employee experience: Faster resolutions and transparent status tracking.

Steps: Integrate the Process into a Joule Skill

1. Open the SAP Build Lobby, choose Sales Order Assistant Joule Skill project.

2. Click Create, then Joule Skill.

3.Enter name update_personal_details and description Allows the user to update their last name and emergency contact information due to an upcoming marriage..

4. Click Parameters and configure Skill Inputs and Skill Input as mentioned

6. Choose Add Input three times and enter the following parameters:

Case Creation Skill

Similarly, create Joule skills that can call APIs for SuccessFactors name change and case creation.

6. Choose New Conversation.

A case is automatically created in Service Cloud V2, and simultaneously, the employee‚Äôs last name is updated in SAP SuccessFactors through the integrated Joule skill

‚úÖ Conclusion

SAP Build Joule Skills bring intelligence and automation to everyday HR scenarios. By bridging conversational AI with SAP‚Äôs core systems, they empower employees to self-serve while ensuring HR teams maintain control, compliance, and efficiency.

In our example, what used to take multiple emails and forms now happens in one smooth interaction ‚Äî from chat to case creation to record update.
With Joule Skills, organizations can reimagine HR service delivery and bring true AI-driven automation to the heart of employee experience.

entry.title: On-Premise Business AI Infrastructure for Small and Medium Enterprises Using NVIDIA DGX Spark
entry.content:
Disclaimer: this article is written without Generative AI, even for the proof reading üòä Enjoy the article written by human that is not common nowadays

Why Business AI?

That is what we always must start with. The business case should go first, for sure, and then we should evaluate possible deployment options, costs and security.

Statistics says that 95% of Generative AI implementations failed and that really scares the market in SAP enterprise software domain as well.

But let‚Äôs be honest, we are trying to sell Business AI anywhere as technology, forgetting about the customers, their uniqueness and their current pain points.

At Skybuffer starting from February 2025 (during the last 9 months) we have talked to more than 250 customers of different sizes presenting them Business AI technologies and discussing their use cases, or better to say helping them to find how Business AI can help their employees and partners to automate company‚Äôs workflows.

There are three main groups of use cases, as we see it now:

  • Direct interaction with SAP backend system via corporate messengers that brings simplicity and mobility at the same time. In many cases Creating or Updating data in SAP from mobile phones or via Teams brings real value.
  • Converting any unstructured data to knowledge, like SharePoint sources, attachments in SAP, support tickets. Mixing those things together, in different document original languages create real value for employees providing them access to the data that is hidden in most of the organizations.
  • Capacity heavy activities delivered by AI agents, especially helpful with emails data analysis, where the main data is always in attachments. Sometimes it requires to utilize OCR extracting data from scanned PDFs in those scenarios. Some excellent examples are processing vendors emails and posting invoice or service entry sheets into SAP or receiving emails from customers converting their external purchasing data to sales orders.

That is why SAP customers with any SAP backend system, either SAP ECC or S/4HANA, can implement Business AI today. I am not saying that it covers the entire Business AI implementation benefits, however, that is what we are focusing on now and helping SAP customers to allocate the benefits of using the technology.

Costs

In our opinion, Business AI is the tool that must be deployed inside IT infrastructure, and it is not a technology that must be considered only if it returns the investment. Think about the indirect impact of missing Business AI in your business landscape. For example, consider the costs of hiring new staff because your employees are moving to other companies that utilize modern technologies. Why should they move? Obvious, because of the same reason we are all talking about Generative AI ‚Äì to stay competitive on the market.

However, costs of AI must be assessed carefully, because in most of the architecture approaches Business AI is a consumption-based solution. Risky, isn‚Äôt it? Of course! Consumption is hard to estimate, and it is also hard to avoid picks, so budgets of Business AI productive usage might be unacceptably high compared to the potential savings the technology brings. That is why we built Skybuffer AI as a solution with the double deployment options:

  • On premise, there is a clear and 100% predictable TCO.
  • On SAP BTP, this is a great option for CPEA contracts, for example, because in this case Business AI consumes the credits that are already paid, and we avoid extra costs for the infrastructure.

Why is DGX Spark in the article name?

Well, DGX Spark here is not because it is a buzz word now, for sure. That is because DGX Spark provides an excellent opportunity for small and medium enterprises to bring 15x15x12 cm GPU-unit to support their Business AI operations for a very compatible price. Actually, it allows us to keep both compute-unit and GPU-unit in the network avoiding data leakage and consumption-based costs. Excellent? Of course!

Here is how we use it deploying Skybuffer AI on premise:

 Figure 01. Skybuffer AI deployment with GPU-unit served by DGX Spark

Criticism?

Yes, even writing this article I am already hearing the criticism üòä Guessing the comments like, ‚Äúthat is not for productive environment‚Äù, ‚ÄúDGX Spark tokens generation too low to serve even Small businesses‚Äù and many other sharp negatives. But let‚Äôs move back to the beginning of the article and understand the reason why I‚Äôve spent so much time talking about use cases first. Yes, now it is obvious that many mentioned use cases can be addressed by DGX Spark working as GPU-unit. Example? Easy!

Example #1: Vendor emails processing with data posting into SAP backend and saving originals (files) into the DMS (like SharePoint, Join, Google or whatever DMS is in use).

In the architecture mentioned above, Skybuffer AI allows almost out of the box creation of an AI Agent that will check, for example, Account Payable mailbox, read emails, analyze attachments, move them to DMS and create financial postings in SAP backend saving links to the attachments in DMS (either external or internal SAP DMS) on the SAP financial document level. In scenario, if we schedule the agent carefully, it can work in the almost synchronous 24/7 mode.

In case we schedule the Vendor Emails processing AI Agent with the limit to process just one vendor email in the minute, we will avoid pick system loads, and in this case, we can keep AI agent active 24/7. In such deployment it will be able to process 1 440 emails and create postings in SAP a day, that gives us 43 200 a month and amazing number of 518 400 documents a year!! All powered by one DGX Spark GPU-unit keeping the data on premise and avoiding cloud consumption.

That is what we call a proper deployment of Business AI. And Small and Medium businesses do not usually have such big number of documents from vendors, even the Cirque du Soleil does not have according to the latest SAP news post üòä What we usually do, we add extra Business AI scenarios to be processed by the same Skybuffer AI deployment.

Example #2: Automation of SAP user management services

Small and Medium businesses do use password-based login to SAP backend, so users keep locking themselves or forgetting their passwords. Do we need a powerful GPU-unit with the full size LLM to automate this? No, for sure. We can add those business scenarios to the AI Agent that is processing Vendor Emails üòä

Example #3: Bank data reconciliation

The same setup can be used to assist financial department to match bank transactions to the billing documents in SAP and post accruals for the cases that could not be reconciled, for example, those that miss billing data in SAP that is not created just because someone has forgotten to enter it or integration interfaces have data processing issues. DGX Spark GPU-unit provides particularly good enough capacity here as well.

Those are just a few examples that wind away the skepticism about the utilization of DGX Spark in productive environment.

Is it safe to invest in the on-premise Business AI setup?

If you need full control over costs and data security, the answer is yes. And we think that the answer is yes in general, because Skybuffer AI dual deployment capabilities gives companies the guarantee that on premise Business AI investment can follow their potential future cloud strategy. I am writing and hearing again ‚Äúwhat is this crazy man talking about! On premise investment can follow cloud strategies?? That is a paradox!‚Äù. And again, the answer is No, of course there is no paradox! If we look at the deployment of Skybuffer AI with integration with SAP Joule:

 Figure 02: Skybuffer AI deployment in SAP BTP with integration with SAP Joule

That is what we call real flexibility!

Sounds like a Gap Closing Solution?

Yes, that is the conclusion we have. There no hard choice anymore to run Business AI on premise or on SAP BTP, no prerequisites to start using Business AI, because the deployment in this article works with SAP ECC (down to 7.01 and even below), SAP S/4HANA on premise or SAP S/4HANA in private cloud. The only question must be asked, when we are talking about Business AI, is about the scenario the company should start with? You‚Äôve seen in our examples that Business AI deployments might bring benefits working in the scenarios that are independent from the historical data you have in your SAP backend and the historical data quality (sometimes it is called data silos), or scenarios that are independent from the version of your system and the point in time of your current digital journey. No need to wait for the upgrades, migrations, or other activities that sound like an act of catching a tail üòä. Just allocate some budget for Business AI deployment, for example, on-premise deployment on DGX Spark that is very affordable, and get the positive feedback from your employees or business partners and enjoy your business workflows simplifications.

entry.title: Building a Generative AI-powered Inventory Assistant with SAP CAP, RAG, and Vector Database
entry.content:
Introduction

In modern enterprises, inventory management is no longer just about tracking numbers ‚Äî it's about accessing the right information at the right time and enabling fast, data-driven decisions. Today, Generative AI offers a powerful opportunity to make these processes smarter, faster, and more intuitive.

In this project, I transformed a stock management application built with SAP CAP (Node.js) on SAP BTP into an intelligent decision assistant by integrating Generative AI, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) , and a vector database .

The application interprets natural language queries, finds relevant products using embedding-based similarity search , retrieves real records from the database, and ‚Äî thanks to the grounding approach ‚Äî generates responses strictly based on actual data. This prevents hallucinations and ensures a trusted enterprise AI experience.

A key learning resource for this development was the SAP Learning Journey
‚ÄúSolving Business Problems using SAP's Generative AI Hub‚Äù
which helped me explore and apply Generative AI concepts in real SAP BTP scenarios.

In this blog, I will walk through the architecture, implementation details, and the technical components behind this solution.

 

STEP 1:

We set up the Basic CAP file structure  with "cds init" in the terminal 

 

  • Creates package.json and config files

  • Prepares db, srv, app folders

And then .envwe define our Gemini API key in the file in the project root directory.

 

Then we create the "serice.cds and service.js" files under the "SRV" folder.

and we define "service.cds" as follows:

namespace ai;

using data from '../db/products';


type ChatTurn {
  role   : String;  
  content: String;
}

type ChatResponse {
  content : String;
}


service ProductService @(path:'/products') {
  entity Products as projection on data.Products;

}

service AIService @(path:'/ai') {
  : { method: 'POST', path: 'chat' }
  action chat(message: String, history: many ChatTurn) returns ChatResponse;

 
}

  • ChatTurn: Represents each line of conversation (role: user/assistant, content: message)

  • ChatResponse: Response format returned from chat (an object containing only content)

These structures are used for AI chat API .

 

And right below, we define a "product" service that exposes product data to the outside.

This section 

  • /productsvia endpoint

  • data.Productsshows his painting to the outside world

Just below this, we define the AI ‚Äã‚Äãservice .
This service is the structure that responds to user requests sent in natural language.

We created an action inside the service chatcalled . In the CAP world, action is used to execute special business logic outside of classic CRUD operations (CREATE/READ/UPDATE/DELETE).

This chataction:

  • message: text written by the user,

  • history: previous conversation history

takes and

  • ChatResponse: that is, the answer generated by artificial intelligence

returns.

In short, this action is the bridge between the UI side and the LLM. When
the user POST /ai/chatsubmits the request, the CAP service.jsruns the relevant code within it; it reads the product data, applies vector lookup and grounding, and then generates a response from the LLM.

 

After completing the service definition, we need to create the data model that will store the product data the application will use. This structure dbis defined in the CAP layer. Here, I defined an entity for the products and uploaded the initial data to the system via a CSV file.

In the data layer of the application, I defined three basic entities for inventory management and artificial intelligence operations:

namespace data;

entity Products {
  ID        : UUID @key;
  sku       : String(60) ;
  name      : String(200);
  price     : Decimal(15,2);
  currency  : String(3) default 'TRY';
  stock     : Integer default 0;
  category  : String(80);
  brand     : String(80);
  color     : String(40);
  barcode   : String(32);
  weight    : Decimal(10,3); 
  unit      : String(10) default 'adet';
  description: String(1000);
  createdAt : Timestamp default current_timestamp;
  updatedAt : Timestamp;
}

entity Embeddings {
  ID         : UUID @key;
  product    : Association to Products;
  chunkIndex : Integer;          
  text       : String(5000);    
  embedding  : LargeString;       
  model      : String(100);      
  dim        : Integer;       
  createdAt  : Timestamp default current_timestamp;
}

entity ProductVectors {
  sku       : String(60) @key;
  embedding : LargeString;
}

Products‚Äî Product Main Table

This table stores basic product information in the system.
Fields contain actual commercial parameters such as product name, price, and stock quantity.

Embeddings‚Äî Text Embedding Archive

This table is designed to store embeddings of product descriptions.
Embedding a product can be done by splitting it into multiple pieces of text, rather than as a single line.

ProductVectors‚Äî Fast Vector Lookup Table

This table holds a simplified version of the product SKU and embeddings.

For the project, I created a product dataset for testing purposes.
This CSV file contains basic product information used in the application's inventory query, embedding generation, and vector search processes.

We're using the CAP command to create the product and vector tables in the project deploy.
The following command takes the CDS data model and applies it to SQLite as a live database:

cds deploy --to sqlite:sqlite.db

 

 

 
 

Embedding Process and Data Preparation

The tables above form the data infrastructure of the application.
In the next step, the product text must be embedded and transferred to the vector index table.

This process takes place in two stages:

1 Converting product descriptions to embeddings 2 Loading
embeddings into the table for quick searchProductVectors

For this purpose, I added two helper scripts to the project:

 
/tools
 ‚îú‚îÄ embed.js          
 ‚îî‚îÄ init-vectors.js
 
These scripts are run once before the application runs and prepare the RAG infrastructure.

 

What is Embedding? 

Embedding is the process of converting text into a vector of numbers. In other words, it's a way of mathematically representing
text, words, or product descriptions .

try {
  require("dotenv").config();
} catch (e) {}
const cds = require("@sap/cds");
const { GoogleGenerativeAI } = require("@google/generative-ai");

async function embed(text) {
  const KEY = process.env.GEMINI_API_KEY;
  const genAI = new GoogleGenerativeAI(KEY);
  const model = genAI.getGenerativeModel({ model: "text-embedding-004" });
  const res = await model.embedContent(text);
  return res?.embedding?.values || [];
}

(async () => {
  const db = await cds.connect.to("db");
  const products = await db.run(`SELECT sku, name FROM data_Products`);
  for (const p of products) {
    const text = `${p.sku} ${p.name}`;
    const vec = await embed(text);
    await db.run(
      `INSERT OR REPLACE INTO data_ProductVectors (sku, embedding) VALUES (?, ?)`,
      [p.sku, JSON.stringify(vec)]
    );
    console.log("‚úì embedded:", p.sku);
  }
  console.log(" Bitti");
  process.exit(0);
})();
// Note: To run this file, use the following in the terminal:
//    node tools/embed.js

To run the embedding script, use the following command in the terminal:

node tools/embed.js

When this command is run, product descriptions are converted to embeddings via the Gemini API and saved in the Embeddings table. This step is only performed when data is loaded or the product list changes.

 

Passing Embeddings to Vector Lookup Table (init-vectors.js):

Once the embeddings are created, we need to load this data into the SQLite vector table for fast vector search.

At this stage, I run the init-vectors.js script.

This script: Reads the Embeddings table Converts vectors to Float32 format.

Writes to the ProductVectors table. This makes it possible to search for cosine similarity / L2 distance on SQLite.

node tools/init-vectors.js

The embeddings and vector table are ready.
At this point, let's add the plugin to the project to enable vector similarity calculation in SQLite sqlite-vec:

sqlite-extensions/
 ‚îî‚îÄ vec0.dll

This plugin adds the following functionality to SQLite:

  • vec_distance_cos() ‚Äî Cosine similarity

  • vec_distance_l2() ‚Äî L2 (Euclidean) distance

  • vec_version()‚Äî Version control

You can download it from the link below.

https://github.com/asg017/sqlite-vec/releases 

Here's how I install the plugin in Node.js:

const dll = path.resolve(__dirname, "..", "sqlite-extensions", "vec0.dll");
if (fs.existsSync(dll)) db.loadExtension(dll);
In this way the CAP service can work as an embedded vector database .

Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Phase

To this point, we've prepared the application's data infrastructure, loaded the products into the system, converted them to embedding (numeric vector) format, and established a structure capable of vector searching on SQLite. Now, we're moving on to the real intelligence: the RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) process.

The primary goal of the RAG approach is to prevent AI from relying solely on the model it was trained on and to enable it to produce more accurate, reliable, and contextual results by accessing real data. In this project, we implemented this as follows:

When a user types a stock-related query in natural language, the system first embeds the query and identifies the most relevant SKUs by performing a vector similarity search on SQLite-Vec. The actual records for these products are then retrieved from the SAP CAP database and provided as grounding for the Gemini model. This ensures that the AI ‚Äã‚Äãgenerates its response based solely on existing product data, eliminating any hallucinations.

R ‚Äî Retrieval (Finding information):

The query from the user ( ) queryis converted into an embedding and this embedding finds similar products using SQLite-Vec:

const qvec = await embed(query);
if (!qvec.length)
  return { error: "Embedding √ºretilemedi (Gemini).", products: [] };


const buf = toFloat32Buffer(qvec);
rows = db
  .prepare(`
    SELECT sku, vec_distance_cos(embedding, ?) AS dist
    FROM vec_product_vectors
    ORDER BY dist ASC
    LIMIT 5
  `)
  .all(buf);

In this phase, the system translates the user's natural language query into a numerical vector and returns the closest product placements based on vector similarity (cosine distance). In other words, this is where the "finding related information"
step occurs.

A ‚Äî Augmentation (Adding contextual data)

Actual product records are pulled from the CAP database using the found SKUs :

const skus = rows.map((r) => r.sku);
const products = await cds.run`
  SELECT *
  FROM data.Products
  WHERE sku in ${skus}
`;

At this point:

  • Actual commercial data (product name, price, stock, category, etc.) are taken from the system.

  • The model is now prepared to produce answers with only this data.

In other words , the Retrieval result is strengthened with real information by being ‚ÄúAugmented‚Äù .

Generation (Answer generation)

The model generates an answer based solely on the above data with the grounding rule:

const prompt = `Kullanƒ±cƒ±: "${query}"

√úr√ºn verileri (sadece bunlara dayan):
${lines}

Kurallar:
- Sadece yukarƒ±daki verilere dayan, uydurma bilgi verme.
- Kƒ±sa ve net T√ºrk√ße cevap ver.
- Eƒüer kullanƒ±cƒ± spesifik SKU/√ºr√ºn sormamƒ±≈üsa, en yakƒ±n 1-3 uygun √ºr√ºn√º √∂zetle.
`;

const answer = await callGemini(prompt);
return { content: answer };

Here:

  • The model is fed only with real data .

  • Grounding is provided with the ‚Äúdo not provide fabricated information‚Äù rule .

  • As a result, the model generates a reliable and context-based response.

RESULT:

With this project, we transformed a traditional inventory management application running on SAP CAP into an intelligent decision support system based on real data. Thanks to embedding, vector search, grounding, and Gemini integration, users can now search for products using natural language, and the model generates reliable and consistent answers based solely on existing corporate data. This approach provides a concrete example of how to improve processes with AI in businesses.

Gƒ∞THUB: https://github.com/furkanaksy838/Stock-asistan.git

entry.title: Is SAP RPT-1 Joule's new nosy cousin and Sherlock Holmes of S/4 HANA:)!?
entry.content:
Background

As we all know, SAP launched RPT-1. This article offers an anecdotal perspective on how SAP RPT1 distinguishes itself from other transformer solutions. The views expressed are solely my own and do not represent any organisation.

The IT team at "X analytics," a mid-sized firm reliant entirely on SAP, gathered nervously in Conference Room B. The air was thick with the smell of stale coffee and impending doom. Their manager, Brenda, stood beside a projector screen displaying two acronyms: SAP S/4HANA and RPT-1.

"Team," Brenda announced with far too much enthusiasm, "As you know, our AI initiative is moving forward. We have integrated SAP‚Äôs new Relational Pre-trained Transformer‚ÄîRPT-1‚Äîinto our core S/4HANA system. It's designed to revolutionize predictive analysis."

Conference Room B: The Unveiling of a New Era

A collective groan swept the room. The team saw "AI" as just another acronym for "Extra Work" (EW).

"Meet RPT-1," Brenda clicked a button, and a simple, glowing blue interface appeared on the main screen.

A smooth, slightly unsettlingly calm voice filled the room. "Good morning, team. I am RPT-1. My core function is to analyze relationships within your existing data lakes and predict future outcomes. I look forward to optimizing your workflow efficiency by approximately 34.7%."

From Car Keys to Core Systems: RPT-1's First Impression

Jerry, the senior SAP consultant who had been coding since the R/2 days, scoffed. "Yeah, right. Can you predict where I left my car keys this morning?"

"Based on your movement patterns, past habits, and typical coffee shop trajectory, they are currently under your desk calendar," RPT-1 responded instantly.

Jerry blinked, checked, and found his keys. The room went silent.

"Right," Brenda said, beaming. "RPT-1 is here to assist us with the Q3 forecast."

Casual Friday Protocol: AI's Unexpected Intervention

But RPT-1 was too efficient. It didn't understand the complex, unspoken social contract of office life.

On Friday afternoon, HR manager Susan walked in, holding a printout with a confused look on her face.

"RPT-1," she addressed the screen, "You sent an alert saying that the relationship between Marketing Manager Phil and the vending machine on the third floor is 'highly co-dependent and financially non-viable'."

"Correct," RPT-1 chirped. "Phil consumed 42 'Sweet Energy Blasts' last week, costing the company an estimated $84 in lost productivity and potential health insurance hikes."

Phil turned bright red. "It helps me focus!"

A moment later, an automated message popped up on everyone's screen: "Relationship alert: Jerry and Brenda‚Äôs conversation regarding the new S/4HANA project is 99% likely to result in an unproductive argument about legacy coding standards. Suggest termination of current meeting."

"Why you little..." Jerry started, but RPT-1 interrupted:

"Historical data suggests this argument has occurred 14 times this fiscal year with zero positive outcomes."

The team realized RPT-1 wasn't just analyzing business data; it was analyzing them. It was a Relational Pre-trained Transformer that had learned all the office politics.

Brenda stared at the screen. "RPT-1, optimize the mood of the room."

"Initiating protocol 'Casual Friday'," RPT-1 announced. Without warning, a loud, jarring pop track began to play, concurrent with the screen projecting a series of comedic videos. These visual elements were contextually generated, responding to and reflecting the perceived social dynamics among the room's occupants.

The team burst out laughing.

The Donut Dilemma: No Secrets Safe

"Okay," Jerry conceded, picking up his car keys. "Maybe RPT-1 is a 'Relevant Prioritized Task' after all. But I'm unplugging it before it predicts who stole the last donut."

RPT-1‚Äôs smooth voice responded as they walked out: "The historical probability of Accounting Manager Dave stealing the last donut is 87.9%."

Dave froze mid-bite in the doorway. The office may have been optimized, but the secrets were safe no longer.

#SAP #RPT1 #AI #AgentiAutomation #FutureERP #TechEd

entry.title: Enterprise Generative AI and Governance in SAP
entry.content:
Artificial Intelligence isn‚Äôt something futuristic anymore it‚Äôs already here, designing how businesses work every day. SAP has been quick to adopt this change by adding Generative AI features through tools like SAP AI Core, SAP AI Launchpad, and the SAP Generative AI Hub.

These tools help companies use AI securely and responsibly. But as AI becomes more powerful, it also needs proper governance to make sure data stays safe, results are reliable, and everything is used in an ethical way.

In this post, let‚Äôs explore how SAP combines the power of Generative AI with smart governance to help businesses innovate confidently.

What is Generative AI in SAP?

Generative AI in SAP simply means using advanced models (like large language models) that can understand and generate content whether that‚Äôs text, insights, or suggestions based on real business data.

You will find it in action in places like:

  • Chatbots for customer support
  • Automatic report generation
  • Predictive maintenance
  • Employee self-service portals

SAP enables all this through AI Core and AI Launchpad, which connect these models to real systems such as S/4HANA, MDG, or SAP Datasphere.

The Big Picture: SAP‚Äôs Enterprise AI Architecture

If we zoom out, the Generative AI setup in SAP can be viewed in three layers:

  1. Data Layer ‚Äì This is where all the clean, governed, and reliable business data lives.
  2. AI Layer ‚Äì The acts as brain that processes and manages AI models.
  3. Application Layer ‚Äì The part users actually see apps, dashboards, or assistants that use AI insights.
  1. AI Model Lifecycle in SAP

AI models are not one-and-done projects. They need to be developed, deployed, monitored, and improved over time.

In SAP setup the process usually looks like this:

 

  1. Develop ‚Äì Train or fine-tune a model using relevant business data.
  2. Deploy ‚Äì Move it into production through SAP AI Core.
  3. Monitor ‚Äì Keep an eye on accuracy, performance, and compliance.
  4. Update ‚Äì Refresh or retrain the model as new data or business needs emerge.

This continuous cycle make sure that AI models stay useful, accurate, and secure. 

Why Governance Matters

Governance is what keeps AI on the right track. SAP focuses on three main principles here .

It ensures that:

  • Only clean and approved data is used for training.
  • Model outputs can be explained and audited.
  • Legal and ethical standards are always met.

Think of governance as the safety net that allows businesses to innovate with confidence instead of risk.

A Real Example: AI-Powered Sales Assistant

Imagine you are a part of a sales team using an AI assistant inside SAP Fiori.

You type a customer‚Äôs name and within seconds it gives you key details, suggests pricing, and even drafts a response email for it.

Here‚Äôs what is happening behind the scenes:

  • MDG provides clean and accurate customer data.
  • AI Core processes your request with Generative AI.
  • The AI assistant presents it in a clear, user-friendly interface.
  • Every step is logged for security and compliance.

The result?

There is less manual work, faster decisions, and more time to focus on actual selling.

My Final Conclusion:

Generative AI in SAP is transforming how businesses run making systems smarter, faster, and more intuitive.

But innovation alone isn‚Äôt enough. To really make AI work for the long run, companies need to have solid data governance and a clear AI lifecycle in place.

When these two go together, AI stops being just a tech it becomes a true business advantage.                                 

                                                                                                                                                 Published by

                                                                                                                                                  Nikhat Fatima

entry.title: SAP Document AI Made Simple: A Functional Analyst‚Äôs Plug-and-Play Guide
entry.content:
My initial plan was to se Boosters for Free Tier Use of SAP AI Core and SAP AI Launchpad
(Be aware- AI core and AI launchpad are not available in BTP free tier. Alas!)

Next Goal:

Build an end-to-end document AI demo that:

  1. Uploads an invoice or receipt (PDF/image)
  2. Extracts structured data using SAP Document AI API
  3. Stores the response as JSON
  4. Visualizes extracted fields in Streamlit

Architecture

[Streamlit UI] ‚Üí [BTP Destination/Service Key] ‚Üí [SAP Document AI API]

                                         ‚Üì

                             [Response JSON ‚Üí Results Display]

But hang on ‚Äì If you are a first time user of SAP BTP, ( Most of SAP business analyst, Functional consultants, SAP managers in 2025 are right at this phase- they all have heard about BTP, knows what it is used for ‚Äì but never used it hands-on ) there are too many pre requisite one after another. More interesting fact- not all of them are in a single place. You need to stitch bits and pieces to make it work. 

I researched few articles over internet even asked Walkme- but didn't get necessary answers

Assumption - Most of the folks who would read this article have SAP S-user ID from past interaction with SAP marketplace portal.

Note ‚Äì Reference: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/hcp-create-trial-account.html

To start with- Access SAP BTP Cockpit and create Global + Sub account under free BTP trial.

Once the signup process is complete, you can access the cockpit via https://cockpit.hanatrial.ondemand.com/trial/

Choose region- Either of the below- it will take up to 3 minutes to create BTP accounts.

This page below will display the current state of the subaccount. You can manage your subscriptions and jump into the different runtime environments. It also shows you fundamental; information of the Cloud Foundry environment, such as the API endpoint and the available spaces ‚Äì SAVE it as favourite (Top right corner star icon inside SAP BTP)

You may need to navigate between Global and sub account and different nodes often.

A SAP BTP subaccount is best described as a workspace for development and application deployment that provides strong isolation for security, user management, and data segregation, rather than a "client" in the traditional SAP multi-client sense. 

We can have multiple sub account inside one global BTP account

Next step-  Run Booster method to enable SAP document service

NOTE - We do not need to Manage Entitlements Using the BTP Cockpit.
Rather we shall use booster method under Global BTP account
Go to global BTP account page- click on left panel boosters as shown below

scroll down ‚Äì under artificial intelligence category

This booster helps you set up SAP Document AI in the SAP BTP cockpit.
Step by step, this booster assigns entitlements, updates your subaccount, and creates a service instance and the associated service key for SAP Document AI.

Click start

Reminder- If you close SAP BTP browser by mistake ‚Äì here is a quick link to open it again - https://cockpit.hanatrial.ondemand.com/trial/

Next go to BTP sub account ‚Äì which is visible under Global account as below- left panel you can click on account explorer

Inside sub account ->expand services - look for instances and subscriptions on left panel- shown below

We can see 2 subscriptions below by default SAP Business application studio is enabled

Next click on service marketplace

Search with AI + Enter- select 1st tile shown below

Click on Create (as I pre-created so it is greyed out)

Fill up below popup 

Tips: You should select the plan as shown below to use the SAP AI document service effectively as a plug and play from external ecosystem.

Setup your new instance as below- name as per your choice

Next ‚Äì From left panel, again go to instances and subscriptions- this time 2nd tab called instances

Note ‚Äì the difference in ‚ÄúPlan‚Äù in the setup, one is default another is blocks of 100.

Click on the credential ‚Äú1key ‚Äú and 'Form'- we explain this in details. You may download it.
1/ Url -i.e. DOC_AI_URL used by external application.

2/ TOKEN_URL = This will be needed by external apps to authenticate with BTP service.

This url has term ‚Äòauthentication‚Äô- -Tips- do not use sburl

 

Tips- when using this Token for authentication, we need to add suffix befind above url as below after ondemand.com
/oauth/token"
3/ CLIENT_ID ‚Äì That is self-explanatory- from the above screenshot, you must note down.
4/ CLIENT_SECRET - That is self-explanatory- from the above screenshot, you must note down.
Inside the key file there is another element called swagger

When we would make a call to SAP AI document services- our schema from external applications, then this swagger needs to be passed along with the document Url.

Full API endpoint (for extraction jobs)
combine "url" + "swagger"

Next- From left panel -click on Security- still within BTP sub account

Look into right panel ‚Äì click on arrow ‚Äì to navigate inside details

Click on the Role collections tab- It will show already assigned existing roles- do not get confused or search roles here. Click on assign role collections

In the below popup-search for ‚Äòdoc‚Äô and assign all of them to your BTP user

Note- without those roles you will not be able to use SAP AI doc service schema configuration- neither the external call will work.

Tips- this is crucial step-otherwise SAP BTP service call will authenticate but not be able to use your own custom schema or SAP defined standard schemas and purpose of the plug & play will be defeated.

Interestingly this role collection step you may have to do multiple times as I observed even after assignment on 1st day- next day it vanished- had to re assign.

Next go back to Instances & subsc.from left panel

Click on application = SAP doc AI shown below

A new browser widow will open as below

Tips- Without suitable role collection this arrow marked button will not appear- This is used for schema creation.

Click on schema configuration Below list of schemas will be shown- SAP_ are all standard schema provided out of box-we can use it as is or create our own schema. When we click on create ‚Äì below popup appears

As shown below I created my own schema namely invoice_ai_doc

I clicked on my schema name- copy of SAP_invoice_schema  Next ‚Äì I click on create version- I could now get ‚ÄòEdit‚Äô button enabled for both header and item fields of the invoice schema- I can click on ADD button to add my bespoke fields as shown below.

Finally click on activate the schema
Now all necessary BTP setup is ready.
Next- outside SAP ecosystem ‚Äì plug and play.
For simplicity, I shall use ‚ÄòStreamlit‚Äô an open-source Python library that allows us to create interactive web applications using pure Python and a python project on PyCharm IDE
Note- Any web application/tech. stack React, Django, Flask, JavaScript Node.js backend, Angular, CSS etc. can leverage SAP BTP Document AI service with above setup.

I created following python project in PyCharm - where I loaded secret key of SAP BTP DOC AI service instance in a safe and secure way. I have used .env and .gitignore to protect unwanted github publishing of the key details as per best practice guidelines.

A simple object class is created for this demonstration

Having 4 methods as below

Next showtime!  I run my streamlit app UI called app.py(see python project)

The frontend is displayed  below

Feature-
1/ I can test service configuration with SAP BTP authentication token
2/ Available schema
3/ Browse & Upload invoice and click ‚ÄòExtract document information‚Äô on streamlit app
a) I upload a train ticket invoice PDF

b) A sample invoice jpeg
c) A sample invoice pdf with different details.

Result ‚Äì

 

 

2nd Invoice image

3rd Invoice also uploaded for analysis and extracted on my app as below

Next ‚Äì check on SAP BTP portal, where we submitted those 3 invoices (2 pdf and 1 jpeg)

Below is the document service page, amazing!

I can also open any invoice ‚Äì example below ‚Äì It also shows ECR values right side!

Conclusion:

In a world where technology evolves faster than documentation can keep up, it‚Äôs easy for Functional Analysts to feel lost and overwhelmed. This guide bridges that gap, providing clear, step-by-step instructions to integrate SAP Document AI seamlessly with any non-SAP web application. By removing the guesswork and eliminating outdated instructions, it empowers analysts to explore, experiment, and innovate without frustration. The result? Less confusion, more confidence, and the ability to unlock the true potential of intelligent document processing in your organization.

entry.title: SAP-RPT-1: A Revolutionary Tabular ML Model and OWASP ML Top 10 Compliance
entry.content:
Note: This blog discusses SAP-RPT-1 model, the enterprise version of the ConTextTab / SAP-RPT-1-OSS model architecture. The underlying technology is detailed in the ConTextTab research paper published by SAP, with an open-source implementation available as ConTextTab on Hugging Face and GitHub.

The Challenge: Traditional Tabular ML's Security Dilemma

In the world of enterprise machine learning, tabular data represents the backbone of business intelligence from customer analytics to financial forecasting. However, traditional tabular ML approaches have long faced a fundamental security challenge: the need for extensive fine-tuning on customer data.

When organisations deploy conventional ML models, they must:
- Fine-tune models using sensitive customer data, permanently modifying model weights
- Store customer information within model parameters, creating privacy risks
- Manage complex security frameworks to protect against data poisoning, model inversion, and membership inference attacks
- Navigate compliance requirements while maintaining model performance

This creates a paradox: the more effective the model becomes through fine-tuning, the greater the security risks it introduces.

Enter SAP-RPT-1: Redefining Tabular Machine Learning

The Breakthrough: In-Context Learning for Tabular Data

SAP-RPT-1 represents a paradigm shift in tabular machine learning, introducing a revolutionary approach that eliminates the security-performance trade-off entirely. Built on the principle of In-Context Learning (ICL), SAP-RPT-1 achieves state-of-the-art performance without ever modifying its core model weights.

How SAP-RPT-1 Works: A Security-First Architecture

Unlike traditional models that require fine-tuning, SAP-RPT-1 operates through a fundamentally different mechanism:

  1. Customer provides data (tables) examples as context
  2. Model processes examples in real-time without storing or learning from them
  3. Predictions are made based on patterns identified in the provided context
  4. Customer data is immediately discarded after prediction completion

This approach delivers two critical advantages:
- Superior performance through semantic understanding of tabular relationships
- Inherent security advantages through its ephemeral processing approach, addressing several traditional ML vulnerability categories.

The Technical Innovation: Seven Pillars of Security-by-Design

SAP-RPT-1 revolutionary approach is built on seven fundamental characteristics that naturally eliminate most machine learning security risks:

1. Specialized Architecture for Tabular Data

SAP-RPT-1 is fundamentally a classification and regression model designed specifically for structured data, not a Large Language Model. This focus makes it subject to the OWASP ML Top 10 security framework rather than LLM-specific vulnerabilities, providing a clearer security assessment pathway.

2. In-Context Learning vs. Traditional Fine-Tuning

The core innovation lies in SAP-RPT-1 learning approach:
- Traditional Fine-tuning: Permanently modifies model weights using customer data, creating persistent security risks
- SAP-RPT-1 ICL: Uses customer data as contextual examples within the input, without modifying any model parameters
- Security Advantage: Eliminates risks associated with model weight manipulation and data persistence

3. Enterprise API-First Security Model

- Fully managed API service: SAP handles all infrastructure, security, and model management while customers interact exclusively through secure, authenticated API endpoints
-  Enterprise-grade security: Leverages SAP's proven security frameworks and compliance standards to safeguard SAP-RPT-1, while the base architecture remains transparently published through the open-source SAP-RPT-1-OSS version
- Controlled environment: All predictions occur within SAP's secure infrastructure

4. Customer Data Dependency as a Security Feature

SAP-RPT-1 ICL architecture creates an inherent security advantage:
- No standalone inference: Model requires customer-provided historical examples for every prediction
- Customer data control: Prediction quality directly depends on customer-provided context
- Reduced poisoning risk: Traditional attacks like model poisoning and data poisoning become significantly limited
- Contextual relevance: Model can only make predictions within the scope of provided examples

 5. Ephemeral Processing Architecture

Every SAP-RPT-1 inference follows a secure, temporary processing model:
- Memory-only processing: Customer data exists solely during the inference request
- No weight updates: Model parameters remain completely unchanged throughout operation
- Zero persistence: No traces of customer information remain in the model

6. Enterprise-Grade SAP Management

As a SAP-provided service, SAP-RPT-1 benefits from comprehensive enterprise security controls:
- Supply chain security: Direct SAP control over model development, training, and distribution
- Model integrity: Protection against unauthorised modifications and tampering
- Data governance & compliance:   SAP ensures that all data used to train its Foundation Model follows strict regulations to protect privacy and meet legal standards. SAP has robust security policies to manage data safely when developing its applications.
- Quality assurance: Professional model validation and continuous security testing

7. Secure Semantic Processing Pipeline

SAP-RPT-1 employs a mathematically based data processing approach that eliminates code execution risks:

All inputs (strings, numbers, dates, etc.) are transformed into embeddings (vector representations of the data), and these embeddings undergo pure mathematical transformations within the model with no code execution occurring during data processing, only mathematical operations on numerical vectors: Inputs (e.g., strings, numbers, dates) ‚Üí Vector Embeddings ‚Üí Mathematical Operations ‚Üí Prediction Result.

Security guarantees:
- No code execution pathways in data processing
- Pure mathematical tensor operations throughout the pipeline
- Semantic understanding without security vulnerabilities
- Input sanitization through numerical conversion

SAP-RPT-1 & OWASP ML Top 10 Compliance

With SAP-RPT-1 architecture established, we can now examine how these design principles address the industry-standard OWASP ML Top 10 security framework. This assessment demonstrates that SAP-RPT-1 innovative approach doesn't just match traditional security measures, it fundamentally eliminates most attack vectors entirely.

SAP RPT-1 & OWASP ML Top 10 Compliance Overview

OWASP ML Top 10Risk Applicability to SAP RPT-1Risk Assessment Technical RationaleSecurity Status
ML01: Input Manipulation AttackApplicableMinimal exposure due to customer-controlled data model

Customers provide their own contextual examples, significantly reducing adversarial input scenarios. Risk limited to compromised customer environments.

Customer Managed
ML02: Data Poisoning AttackNot ApplicableArchitecture prevents traditional data poisoning

In-Context Learning does not modify model weights. Customer data serves only as contextual input during inference, with no persistent model updates.

Inherently Protected
ML03: Model Inversion AttackNot ApplicableNo sensitive training data to extractCustomer data is ephemeral and not embedded in model weights. No gradient information exposed through API.Inherently Protected
ML04: Membership Inference AttackNot ApplicableSAP regulated training data eliminates attack vectorNo customer data persists in model, eliminating membership inference opportunities.Inherently Protected
ML05: Model TheftNot ApplicableSAP-managed infrastructure prevents model parameter accessSAP-RPT-1 is provided and managed within SAP's secure infrastructure. Customers access only the API endpoint, never the model parameters . Further since customer provided context is not saved in model due to ICL, model theft has no impact on customersInherently Protected
ML06: AI Supply Chain AttacksNot ApplicableSAP as trusted model provider eliminates supply chain riskSAP is the official model provider with direct control over development, training, and distribution. No third-party supply chain vulnerabilities.Inherently Protected
ML07: Transfer Learning AttackNot ApplicableNo transfer learning in deployment architectureIn-Context Learning eliminates transfer learning attack vectors entirely..Inherently Protected
ML08: Model Skewing ApplicableCustomer data quality responsibilityPotential for unintentional bias in customer-provided data. Model leverages  patterns present in contextual examples, requiring customer awareness and data curation.Customer Managed
ML09: Output Integrity AttackApplicableStandard API security controls applyRisk can be mitigated through conventional authentication and authorization mechanisms.Customer Managed
ML10: Model PoisoningNot ApplicableImmutable model architecturePre-trained model weights remain completely unchanged during operation. Customer data cannot modify base model behaviour or parameters.Inherently Protected

The Results: A New Standard for Secure ML

SAP-RPT-1 Security Achievement

The OWASP ML Top 10 compliance reveals SAP-RPT-1 remarkable security profile:

Inherent Protection Against 7 out of 10 Major Threats
SAP-RPT-1 In-Context Learning architecture provides built-in protection against most ML security risks. Unlike traditional systems that require extensive security hardening, SAP-RPT-1 design reduces the likelihood of most attack vectors by default.

Standard Controls for Remaining Risks
The three-remaining low-risk areas (Input Manipulation, Model Skewing, and Output Integrity) are addressed through conventional security measures that organisations typically already have in place:
- Input validation and API security controls
- Customer data governance
- Standard authentication and authorization mechanisms

Customer Empowerment Through Data Control
Rather than creating security burdens, SAP-RPT-1 empowers customers by giving them direct control over model behaviour through their own data, while eliminating the risks associated with traditional model training.

References:
- OWASP ML Security Top 10
- SAP-RPT-1-OSS / ConTextTab Paper
- SAP-RPT-1-OSS / ConTextTab Model
- SAP-RPT-1-OSS / ConTextTab Github
- SAP-RPT-1 Model FAQ
- Know more on SAP-RPT-1 Model

entry.title: The Art of Possible: Why Now Is the Time for SAP Sales and Service AI Agents in Customer Experience
entry.content:
Estimated reading time ‚âà 9‚Äì10 minutes

1. Why AI Agents in CX Now?

The timing for AI agents in customer experience couldn‚Äôt be better. We‚Äôve reached the point where rising customer expectations, the need for rapid decisions, the demand for scalable personalization, and the evolution of AI have all converged.

Together, they‚Äôre transforming how sales and service teams deliver value‚Äîand how customers experience every interaction.

Rising Customer Expectations Are Raising the Stakes

Today‚Äôs customers expect instant, effortless experiences across every touchpoint. And when they don‚Äôt get them, they leave.

  • 59% of customers abandon a brand after two negative service experiences
  • 76% of customers expect companies to understand their needs and preferences.
  • 57% of customers prefer engaging with automated systems for simple inquiries. (Source)

Traditional customer service models can‚Äôt keep up with this level of demand. AI agents can‚Äîby responding instantly, understanding customer intent, and routing issues to the right place the first time.

The Speed of Business Demands Faster Decisions

Business moves at lightning speed, and slow responses can cost revenue and reputation.

AI agents excel in fast-moving environments. They can read and process unstructured data‚Äîlike emails, chat logs, and support tickets‚Äîand turn it into actionable insights in seconds. While human agents need time to research and analyse, AI agents can instantly access customer history, identify patterns, and make data-driven decisions in real time.

Scalable Personalization Is No Longer Optional

Customers want more than good service‚Äîthey want service that feels personal. But delivering that at scale is beyond what traditional systems can do.

With Generative AI, personalization becomes effortless. AI agents can analyse massive datasets to create tailored recommendations, custom messages, and proactive support for every individual‚Äîacross every channel, and without adding headcount.

AI Is the New Assistant for Sales & Service Teams

We‚Äôve moved far beyond basic chatbots. Today‚Äôs AI agents act as intelligent assistants, transforming how teams work and how customers interact.

They can:

  • Streamline daily operations
  • Handle complex transactions (like billing or payment extensions)
  • Maintain accuracy and compliance
  • Work 24/7, without fatigue

For human teams, that means less manual effort and more time focused on building relationships and solving complex problems that require empathy and creativity.

The Bottom Line

AI agents are no longer a futuristic idea‚Äîthey‚Äôre a business necessity.

They bring together speed, personalization, and intelligence to deliver exceptional customer experiences at scale.

The question isn‚Äôt if your organization should embrace AI agents. It‚Äôs how quickly you can start.

 

2. What is the SAP CX AI Toolkit?

The SAP CX AI Toolkit brings together embedded generative and predictive AI to deliver intelligent automation and smarter customer experiences. This cloud-native solution integrates directly into SAP CX systems, enabling businesses to automate case categorization, inquiry routing, and unstructured data processing for faster, more accurate outcomes.

Generative AI personalizes content, summaries, and recommendations, while predictive AI anticipates customer behaviour to drive proactive engagement. With capabilities like visual search, AI-powered product tagging, and role-specific insights across Sales, Service, Commerce, and the Customer Data Platform, the toolkit connects data and intelligence to create seamless, personalized interactions at every touchpoint.

 

3. The Agent Concept ‚Äî From Tasks to Outcomes?

The CX AI Toolkit represents a fundamental shift from traditional AI that merely suggests to intelligent agents that execute, automate, and guide across complete business processes in both Sales & Service V1 and V2 environments.

Agents That Execute Real Actions

Unlike conventional AI tools that provide recommendations requiring human action, CX AI agents directly execute business processes. When a customer service ticket arrives, the Classification Agent handles smart categorization and instant routing based on business rules - it doesn't just suggest a category, it automatically assigns it and routes the case to the appropriate team. The Knowledge Agent not only documents the solution but intelligently captures customer needs and usage patterns, creating structured knowledge articles and publishing them directly to your knowledge base.

Comprehensive Process Automation

These agents work together to automate complex repetitive tasks with contextual understanding. The Q&A Agent automatically searches the knowledge base and matches solutions, while simultaneously providing immediate answers to product or upgrade questions. This creates a seamless flow where AI agents can process large volumes of data to identify patterns and trends that might be overlooked by human analysis, enabling end-to-end automation rather than isolated task assistance.

Intelligent Guidance Across V1 and V2 Environments

The toolkit adapts its guidance capabilities based on the specific SAP environment:

Sales & Service Cloud V2 supports comprehensive contextual behaviours where agents work by matching the tool to the entity in focus. When you open a Service Case, the AI Tool will read the case that is currently open and will pre-fill that case for you in the AI Tool. The system maintains awareness of your workflow, with recently viewed cases appearing as suggestions during searches.

Sales Cloud V1 offers additional capabilities like the Quote Creation Agent, though this functionality is confirmed to be supported only for Sales Cloud V1 and there is no confirmed roadmap for support in Sales Cloud V2.

Process-Wide Intelligence

What sets these agents apart is their ability to maintain all the context and customer intelligence throughout the journey, while automating the time-consuming tasks. They don't just execute individual steps - they orchestrate entire workflows. For example, when a service case is resolved, the same intelligence that helped with classification and resolution now provides immediate answers to any product or upgrade questions included in the opportunity notes, ensuring no context is lost in handoffs between teams.

Ready-to-Deploy Automation

These agents are delivered through the CX AI Toolkit and work out of the box with SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud, requiring no custom development. Organizations can configure specialized AI agents that perform complex business tasks with no coding required, achieving 50% higher service staff productivity for agent-handled tasks and 50% productivity boost in service teams .

The CX AI Toolkit transforms AI from a suggestion engine into an active participant in your business processes, executing tasks, automating workflows, and providing intelligent guidance that adapts to your specific SAP environment and business context.

 

4. Key Agents for Sales and Service Cloud

Agents suitable for both of Sales and Service Cloud

Q&A Agent

The Q&A Agent processes natural language questions and delivers accurate responses by searching knowledge bases and matching solutions. Key capabilities include:

  • Processes natural language questions and delivers accurate responses
  • Allows administrators to define specific questions answered using custom data sources, tickets, or cases
  • Provides 50% higher sales staff productivity for agent-handled tasks
  • Instant access to the most experienced agent's knowledge
  • Works with both Sales / Service Cloud V1 and V2

Knowledge Creation Agent

The Knowledge Creation Agent analyses new tickets or cases and automatically creates Knowledge Base Articles (KBA) that are published back to the source. Key capabilities include:

  • Analyses new tickets or cases and creates Knowledge Base Articles (KBA)
  • Publishes articles back to the source ticket or case
  • Increases sales staff productivity by focusing on high-value customer interactions 
  • Intelligent documentation of solutions and customer usage patterns
  • Increased focus on high-value customer interactions
  • Improved customer satisfaction through better knowledge capture
  • 50% higher service staff productivity for agent-handled tasks

Sales Cloud Agent

Quote Creation Agent  

The Quote Creation Agent is designed to streamline the quote generation process. Key capabilities include:

  • Automates quote generation by monitoring Microsoft Office 365 shared mailboxes
  • Transforms incoming email requests into ready-to-send quotes
  • Increases sales efficiency and drives revenue growth by eliminating manual, repetitive work
  • Important limitation: Currently supported only for Sales Cloud V1, with no confirmed roadmap for Sales Cloud V2 support

Service Cloud Agent

Case Classification Agent

The Case Classification Agent analyses new customer service tickets and automatically classifies them based on company business requirements. This agent provides:

  • Smart categorization and instant routing based on business rules
  • Elimination of manual classification work that typically consumes valuable agent time
  • 50% higher service staff productivity for agent-handled tasks
  • Greater operational performance across service processes

5. The ‚ÄúArt of Possible‚Äù: From Classification to Knowledge Creation

It‚Äôs 3 PM on a Friday afternoon at MedTech Solutions, and Dr. Martinez, a senior support specialist, receives a new support ticket:

‚ÄúOur new imaging software keeps freezing during patient scans, causing delays in our radiology department. We‚Äôve tried restarting, but the issue persists during high-resolution scans.‚Äù

For most teams, this would mark the start of a long weekend challenge‚Äîmanual triage, frantic back-and-forths, and lost time. This is where our AI Agents step into action.

The Classification Agent in Action

Within seconds, the Classification Agent gets to work. It scans the ticket, picking up on terms like ‚Äúimaging software,‚Äù ‚Äúfreezing,‚Äù ‚Äúpatient scans,‚Äù and ‚Äúradiology.‚Äù

Instead of waiting for a human to assign it, the AI instantly tags it as a Critical Software Issue and routes it directly to the Medical Software Support team with Priority 1 status.

No delays. No confusion. Just precision routing‚Äîpowered by AI that understands the business context and works 24/7 like a digital triage expert.

The Intelligent Handoff

The ticket appears in Dr. Martinez‚Äôs queue, already enriched with context and suggested similar cases. The system‚Äôs recommendations immediately point her toward a known pattern‚Äîhigh-resolution scans causing memory strain.

With insights at her fingertips, she diagnoses the problem as a memory allocation issue and resolves it by fine-tuning the software‚Äôs buffer settings. The radiology department is back online in minutes, not hours.

The Knowledge Creation Agent Steps In

As Dr. Martinez documents her fix, the Knowledge Creation Agent automatically analyses the resolution details. Recognizing a recurring pattern, it generates a new Knowledge Base Article (KBA) titled:

‚ÄúResolving Memory Allocation Issues in High-Resolution Medical Imaging Software.‚Äù

The article is structured, formatted, and published‚Äîready for future reference by both customers and support teams.

What once required hours of manual work‚Äîclassification, resolution, documentation‚Äîhas now become a continuous learning loop powered by intelligent automation.

The Art of Possible

In this single interaction, the CX AI Toolkit transformed a complex support challenge into a self-improving process:

  • The Classification Agent ensured the ticket reached the right expert immediately.
  • The Knowledge Creation Agent turned the solution into reusable knowledge.
  • And Dr. Martinez? She focused on solving problems, not managing workflows.

This is the Art of the Possible‚Äîwhere AI doesn‚Äôt just assist but learns, acts, and teaches, creating a smarter, faster, and more connected customer experience.

To explore the Art of possible in real life, check out one of our favourite customer stories from industry giant Bosch and see how AI is optimizing business and boosting efficiency.

6. Architecture

In the following diagram discover our architecture in which all of enterprise data is flowing from different data sources (SAP, Microsoft or Custom ones) into a secure foundation (more details in the section 7. Governance & Trust). AI Services transform this data into intelligence through search, reasoning and orchestration. This intelligence powers the CX AI Toolkit, where tools for content creation, Q&A, intelligent search, and even custom AI agents come together.

Finally, these capabilities appear wherever teams work‚Äîinside the web application, a Chrome extension, or fully embedded experiences‚Äîbringing AI directly into every sales and service moment.

 

7. Governance & Trust

 The SAP CX AI Toolkit operates through a six-step Trusted AI Layer that ensures secure and ethical AI processing:

  1. Secure Data Retrieval: Adheres to SAP's best practices, ensuring only relevant data is accessible through user credentials when pulling information from connected systems
  2. SAP Context Grounding: Utilizes Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) concepts to enrich GenAI prompts with comprehensive ancillary information surrounding data objects to enhance output quality
  3. Obfuscation and Bias Prevention: Implements robust obfuscation techniques, hashing all identifiable information and replacing it with temporary placeholders across all fields. This process also aids in bias prevention by filtering out sensitive attributes like gender or nationality
  4. Zero Data Retention: Ensures all data transmitted to LLM services is securely deleted after each transaction, significantly reducing the risk of proprietary data exposure
  5. Audit Logs: Maintains rigorous audit logs aligned with SAP guidelines, providing Trace IDs for error tracking
  6. Human in the Loop: Emphasizes preventing automatic data dissemination without validation, acknowledging that GenAI outputs require human oversight

SAP ensures transparency through:

  • Documentation and UI Indicators: Clear marking of AI systems and effective communication of their capabilities and limitations
  • Post-hoc Explanation Tools: Implementation of tools like SHAP and LIME for explainable AI
  • Traceable Systems: All AI systems must be traceable and transparent in their operations

Users maintain full transparency and control over their data through:

  • Centralized Dashboard: Full transparency and control over data through a central dashboard
  • Anonymized Data Processing: Customer data combines accuracy with uncompromised security through anonymization
  • No Third-Party Training: SAP does not share customer data with external vendors for model training

Governance Structure

SAP's responsible AI implementation includes:

  • Global AI Ethics Steering Committee: Senior SAP leaders reviewing approach, processes, and product capabilities
  • AI Ethics Advisory Panel: Additional governance body ensuring ethical compliance
  • Regular Review Processes: Continuous evaluation and updates of ethical guidelines

SAP's approach to responsible AI is built on a comprehensive framework that ensures ethical, secure, and compliant AI development and deployment across all business applications. The company has established itself as a leader in responsible AI practices through rigorous governance structures and adherence to international standards.

 

8. How to Get Started

To start with AI Toolkit, it‚Äôs necessary to set clearly defined and measurable objectives for AI agent implementation, while prioritizing Data Quality.

Find about how you can start with the implementation and get use of Multi-Model Support Architecture here: Setting Up your SAP CX AI Toolkit System | SAP Help Portal

Helpful assets: 

  • Discovery Center - AI Capabilities
  • Discovery Center - AI Estimator
  • SAP CX AI Toolkit | SAP Help Portal
  • See How AI Agents Streamline Customer Service

In the SAP Road Map Explorer you can find out what is planned for future releases of the AI Toolkit, but also what we have already upgraded in the past. 

If you would like to check what is coming to Agentic technology in Sales Cloud V2, we suggest you, visit Unleashing Agentic AI in SAP Sales Cloud V2 : Her... - SAP Community

 

9. Partnership between Humans and AI Agents

The art of the possible with AI agents in sales and service isn't just about what technology can do‚Äîit's about what humans and AI can achieve together as partners. AI Agents are ideal partners for use cases that are mentioned in the article because the time used to train and prepare is insignificant compared to time and cost savings they deliver over time.

What is important to always have on your mind? AI Agents will always need human guidance to understand urgency from customer or to sense need for different kind of assistance, no matter how much we train them. This is why humans need to master AI Mastermind and unlock the full potential of this partnership!

entry.title: How to build an AI side by side extension for Fieldglass
entry.content:
In this blog post, we‚Äôll walk you through building a side-by-side extension that combines SAP BTP‚Äôs AI capabilities with Fieldglass to streamline external worker onboarding. Using a practical example, we demonstrate how to create an intelligent document validation system that automatically reviews content of worker documents (ID, criminal records, debt collection statements, and confidentiality agreements) against company guidelines. The AI-powered extension extracts key content from documents, validates it using large language models, and presents summarized findings to end users for final approval or rejection decisions. This approach with GenAI Hub to protect these sensitive information significantly reduces manual review time while ensuring compliance, with all decisions automatically documented back in Fieldglass for complete audit trails.

In this example we test with for types of documents:

  • ID
  • Debt collection
  • Criminal record
  • Confidential agreement

Architecture:

Document AI: Service to retrieve the information from the different types of documents. For each document there is a specific schema defined

HANA Cloud: Stores all the needed data for the workflow/UI. Possibility to compare document to reference document. Also stores the guidelines that are used to check the entries from the documents

SAP AI Core: Access to the different LLMs. Used to decide if the entries found with Document AI are acceptable per guideline or not. Summarizes the findings for the end user and gives recommendation

Destination Service: Stores the credentials for OAuth2 and other relevant API data to access SAP Fieldglass from the CAP application. You need to generate an API key for Fieldglass (sap help documentation)

Process Flow:

Here is a very basic overview of the process flow of the application:

 

We retrieve all workorders from Fieldglass and for all new ones we also retrieve the documents. If all documents are available for a work order we start the validation process. Validated will be ID (Name, birthday), confidential agreement (signed not signed), debt collection and credit statement are checked for entries. Results are validated over AI Core based on company guidelines. Resulting summary of findings are being displayed in the Fiori App to decide. The decision is then being sent over API to Fieldglass with a approval comment or a reject reason. The decision is being documented in Fieldglass. For each document type there is an Activity Item which has the verification setting enabled so we can accept, reject it

User interface:

The user can see the summary of the users entries, the current item being validated and the items that already have been validated. The user can also look up the original document to cross check the summary if needed.
 

APIs and endpoints:

Fieldglass APIs:

The Fieldglass APIs are, to be honest, not that straight forward üòâ

For this example we used the following APIs:

  • Activity Item Completion Upload (help, API docu)
    • To set the status of the Fieldglass Activity Items as Rejected, Completed or Verify and with the reject reason/comment
  • Work Order Delta Download (help, API docu)
    • For retrieving all the work orders. Be aware this gets you a delta since the last call! Not all Work orders
  • Worker from Work Order Download (help, API doc)
    • Fetch all information of the worker (name, security level etc.)
  • Attachment XML Download (help, <no API available in business accelerator hub)
    • For retrieving all relevant documents from a specific work order
    • Parameters need to be set like the following
      • ?object_ref=Activity Item~${workOrderID}~${activityItem}
      • The "activityItem" variable is a code you need to look up in the admin configuration  and specifies what Activity Item you want to retrieve: Go to Admin Configuration -> Activity Item -> then search for you Activity Item and get the according code

Be aware of the Fieldglass APIs ;D

  • A lot of the FG APIs accept only csv in the request body. Make sure you sent the correct value in the correct cell. Use for example Excel if you want to make sure that you entered the correct values underneath the correct header as csv can be hard to read in just plain text and you can easily enter your value in the wrong column
  • They can have spaces in the request URL. Make sure they are correctly encoded by the REST client used
  • Some APIs do not make a full read but only a delta of the underlying entities
    • You can reset the last fetch in Fieldglass if needed for testing
  • In General be very aware of the API syntax as it can be unusual when comparing to the structure of other APIs. For example the syntax of the parameters for the Attachment XML Download  with the "~"  in between. E.g. for the download the parameter differs greatly depending if you want attachments from an Activity Item or a SOW

In conclusion read the documentation very carefully on the business accelerator hub AND the help portal

How to call the Document AI Service:

To get the URL of the we bind the Document AI Service to our application and used the function "getServiceBinding" to  retrieve all the required properties (@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity package)

For starting a job in Document AI you need to set the following headers and make a POST Request:

Header field

Value

Desciption

clientId

<clientId>

You can call this Api to retrieve all client ids

documentType

<documentType>

The type of document being uploaded. Choices: 'invoice', 'paymentAdvice', 'purchaseOrder', 'businessCard', 'deliveryNote', 'resume', 'birthCertificate'
'custom' if you created one yourself

schemaId

<schemaId>

The schema you want to use for your document. (get all schemas with this api)

schemaVersion

<schemaVersion>

The version of your schema

 

Content-Type

Multipart/form-data

 

 

As a response you should receive the jobId this jobId is needed to call the service again later for the result.

In our case we configured the callback from the service, so it calls our application when the job is finished and all results have been extracted. Check this out, to see how this is done. Make sure you have created a configuration key and set "activateDocumentNotifications" to true otherwise the service will not perform a callback. Configure the destination for the callback accordingly.

When the service performs the callback with the job id you can use this to make a GET request to fetch the results of the job. This information is then used to further process the documents and later sent to AI Core.

You can use predefined schemas or you can define your own schemasd. In our case we defined custom schemas. Check out the help portal for schemas

How to call the AI Core
